page.title: 03SOCIAL SURVEY-BAWDRIP
page.content: Nearly half the population have lived here more than ten years. Nearly half of the population have lived in the village more than fifty years. A fifth of the people lived in the village before.The commonest number of people living in a house is two. Over half have children, usually three. The children are all ages. Many had to travel to school. Roughly half have a job, most working locally. Most people have hobbies, the most common being sport and gardening. The majority have pets, cats and dogs being most popular. Most people shop in Bridgwater. Few people used public transport, the majority their own cars.People were generally satisfied with the amenities found in the village.
